content.text: Streptococcal toxic shock syndrome is a severe, invasive infection caused by Streptococcus pyogenes (Group A Streptococcus). It is characterized by the rapid onset of shock and multiorgan failure.

items: Evidence of multiorgan dysfunction (e.g., renal impairment, coagulopathy, liver involvement, acute respiratory distress syndrome)
A soft tissue infection (e.g., cellulitis, necrotizing fasciitis) is often the source.

content.text: Early and aggressive treatment is critical. This includes fluid resuscitation, vasopressors, and surgical debridement of any infected tissue.

regimenData.notes: Clindamycin is added to suppress toxin and cytokine production. Intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) may also be considered.
